Public Member Functions

 comp_quad_tree (std::vector< Point > &P)
 Creates the compressed quadtree The constructor creates the tree on a z-order sorted point set. Once completed, every node will know it's left and right child, it's side length, and the z-order range of points contained in it. Construction takes O(n) time.

Public Attributes

std::vector
< comp_quad_tree_node< Point > > 		tree
 Underlying storage for the compressed quadtree The nodes of the tree are stored relative to their z-order. The first n-1 nodes are internal nodes defined by the minimum quadtree box enclosing two points in z-order. Therefore, the first element is the quadtree box defined by point 0 and point 1 in z-order. The last n nodes are leaves defined by a single point, also in z-order.
size_type root
 the root node of the tree The root node is the largest quadtree box in the tree. All other nodes in the tree have the root for an ancestor

Detailed Description

template<typename Point>
class comp_quad_tree< Point >

Builds a compressed quadtree on a vector of z-order sorted points.

Compressed Quadtree class This class contains the functionality needed to build a compressed quadtree containing n-1 internal nodes and n leaf nodes on a z-order sorted point set of size n.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<typename Point>
comp_quad_tree< Point >::comp_quad_tree ( std::vector< Point > &  P  )  [inline]

Creates the compressed quadtree The constructor creates the tree on a z-order sorted point set. Once completed, every node will know it's left and right child, it's side length, and the z-order range of points contained in it. Construction takes O(n) time.

Constructor

Parameters:
P a vector of points (must be sorted in z-order)

Member Data Documentation

template<typename Point>
size_type comp_quad_tree< Point >::root

the root node of the tree The root node is the largest quadtree box in the tree. All other nodes in the tree have the root for an ancestor

root

template<typename Point>
std::vector<comp_quad_tree_node<Point> > comp_quad_tree< Point >::tree

Underlying storage for the compressed quadtree The nodes of the tree are stored relative to their z-order. The first n-1 nodes are internal nodes defined by the minimum quadtree box enclosing two points in z-order. Therefore, the first element is the quadtree box defined by point 0 and point 1 in z-order. The last n nodes are leaves defined by a single point, also in z-order.

tree
